paragraphs: TRAC App gives teams a real-time view of distributed devices and lets admins trigger safe actions like lock, restart, or custom scripts from a single dashboard. Heartbeats and activity hints surface which machines need attention without intrusive monitoring.

A lightweight agent plus clear APIs keep the system modular and privacy-friendly, making it useful for classrooms, labs, and remote teams that need auditability without heavy enterprise tooling. Actions are logged with user, timestamp, and optional notes for compliance.

Policies, tags, and webhook-style alerts make it adaptable to different environments—from labs that want quick lockdowns to teams that just need uptime visibility. The architecture is small enough for internal deployments but can scale into a SaaS seat model.
bullets: Device registry with tags, online/offline status, and optional activity hints.
Remote actions such as lock, restart, or admin-defined commands with audit trails.
Search, filters, and detail views to triage devices quickly from the dashboard.
Alerts for offline or unusual activity with webhook/email-style notifications.
Privacy and safety controls through API-keyed agents, role-based access, and toggleable modules.
